required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Pre-screening Protocol for Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Pre-screening Protocol for Ovarian Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The pre-screening study is established to pre-screen tumor samples from ovarian cancer patients to identify if they, at a later stage of their disease, will benefit from treatment with any investigational cancer drugs available to Oncology Venture, when these drugs are approved for future clinical studies by local authorities.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of ovarian cancer patients with high likelihood of being sensitive to investigational cancer drug
primary_outcome.description: based on FFPE ovarian cancer tissue

secondary_outcome.measure: Retrospective analysis of whether or not the DRP method can predict and confirm the obtained sensitivity to the prior drugs used in the treatment of ovarian cancer

arm_group.description: with formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tumor tissue available

intervention.description: A DRP is an assay that based on samples from a tumor can predict whether the tumor will respond to a specific drug or not.

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples with archival ovarian cancer tumor tissue is collected for measurement using mRNA or microRNA.

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be identified at their already planned treatment and or at control visits at the oncology department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with histological confirmed epithelia ovarian cancer
- Relapse after 2 or more chemotherapies for ovarian cancer
- FFPE tumor tissue available
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other primary malignancy within the last 5 years prior to enrolment
